glsa.title: Python: Multiple integer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Multiple integer overflows may allow for Denial of Service.

background.p: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:

ul.li: David Remahl reported multiple integer overflows in the file imageop.c, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2008-1679). This issue is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2007-4965.

Justin Ferguson discovered that an integer signedness error in the zlib extension module might trigger insufficient memory allocation and a buffer overflow via a negative signed integer (CVE-2008-1721).
Justin Ferguson discovered that insufficient input validation in the PyString_FromStringAndSize() function might lead to a buffer overflow (CVE-2008-1887).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or possibly the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Python.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: The imageop module is no longer built in the unaffected versions.
